p:
In a recent study, it was demonstrated that SARS-CoV-2 and SARS-CoV share a remarkable 96% sequence identity in their 3CL pro and RdRp and 83% sequence identity in their PL pro.
11, 12 Therefore, existing SARS-CoV inhibitors may be effective against SARS-CoV-2.
89, 90
Figure 3 represents the candidate antiviral agents for SARS-CoV-2.
